title: Can I re-finance my home even though the title is in my name and my deceased mother?
question: my mom left her half of the property to my daughter (we are not on speaking terms). My brother is the estate executer since she passed. I want to re-fi without involving her. Is this possible to have him sign the paperwork and not involve the daughter.
answers:
Depending on how title held, it may be possible for you to obtain loan secured by your interest in property.
Probate of deceased mother's interest may be necessary.
Review facts ad title history with probate counsel.
It doesn’t sound like you have an ownership interest so you cannot refinance at all.
